node.title: Travis Scott, Astroworld organisers sued for at least $1 million as victims remembered
node.alt: Women place flowers up against the concert venue fence.
node.description: A clearer picture emerges of the eight victims who died at the Astroworld Festival during a crowd crush as one injured concertgoer sues rapper and event founder Travis Scott for $1 million in damages.
node.content:
["At least two investigations and one civil lawsuit have been filed into the deadly stampede during rapper Travis Scott's Astroworld music festival, as the eight victims of the crowd crush are remembered.", "Manuel Souza, who suffered \"serious bodily injuries\" at the show, is seeking at least $US1 million ($1.3 million) in damages from festival founder Scott and promoters Live Nation, according to a petition filed in Harris County District Court.", "Houston city police chief Troy Finner said his department had opened a criminal investigation by homicide and narcotics detectives, following reports that somebody in the audience had been injecting people with drugs.", "Harris County Judge Lina Hildago also called for an \"objective, independent\" investigation of the rap festival attended by 50,000 people.", "\"Perhaps the plans were inadequate. Perhaps the plans were good but they weren't followed,\" Judge Hildago said.", "The victims, aged between 14 to 27, were killed near the stage when the crowd surged forward, with some suffering cardiac arrests and other medical trauma, officials said.", "", "
Scott posted a video message to Instagram, saying his team was trying to get in contact with the families of the victims.(AP:\u00a0Amy Harris/Invision)
", "At some point, concertgoers approached the stage crew and pleaded with them to stop the show, according to social media video.", "Neither Scott's representatives nor Live Nation immediately responded to requests for comment.", "A clearly emotional Scott posted a video message to Instagram on Sunday, saying his team was trying to get in contact with the families of the victims.", "\"I could just never imagine the severity of the situation,\" he said.\u00a0", "
Young victims remembered
", "", "
Family members and friends have shared accounts of their loved ones with the media and online.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Robert Bumsted)
", "The Houston Chronicle has identified the youngest victim as John Hilgert, a high school freshman who played football and baseball and arrived early to get a good spot to watch the show.", "He went with a 15-year-old friend, the Chronicle reported, citing an interview with the friend's mother, Tracy Faulkner. She bought her son his ticket as a birthday present, a decision she now regrets, the Chronicle said.", "\"John was a good student and athlete and so polite. He was the sweetest and smartest young man.\"", "Brianna Rodriguez's family told People magazine she was among those who perished at the concert. She was 16, a student at Heights High School and loved dancing, according to her family.", "", "
Stacey Sarmiento says her friend Rudy Pe\u00f1a \"brought happiness anywhere he went.\"
", "Rudy Pe\u00f1a was a student at Laredo College in Texas and wanted to be Border Patrol agent, his friend Stacey Sarmiento said. She described him as a people person.", "\"Rudy was a close friend of mine,\" she said. \"We met in high school. He was an athlete.\"", "\"We all came to have a good time \u2026 it was just horrible in there.\"", "
'Huge hole in our lives'
", "Jacob Jurinek, 20, was a junior at Southern Illinois University-Carbondale, where he was \"pursuing his passion for art and media,\" his family said in a statement on Sunday. He was just over two weeks short of his 21st birthday.", "\"We are all devastated and are left with a huge hole in our lives,\" his father, Ron Jurinek, said.", "", "
The second day of the two-day Astroworld Festival was canceled following the crowd crush.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Robert Bumsted)
", "Franco Patino, 21, was working toward a mechanical engineering technology degree at the University of Dayton, with a minor in human movement biomechanics, his father, Julio Patino, said.", "Patino described his son as a charismatic, energetic leader who was active in his community and intent on helping people with disabilities.", "He said his son was working with a team on a new medical device, and that he wanted to find a way to help his mother walk again after she was severely injured in a car accident in Mexico two years ago.", "\"He loved his mum,\" Patino said.", "Danish Baig, who identified himself on Facebook as a district manager for AT&T, and appeared to be a devoted Dallas Cowboys fan, was among those who died at the the concert, his brother Basil Baig said on Facebook.", "The Chronicle reported he\u00a0died trying to protect his fiance from the crush of the crowd, according to\u00a0Basil.", "\"He was [an]\u00a0innocent young soul who would always put others before him. He was a hard-working man who loved his family and took care of us. He was there in a heartbeat for anything. He always had a solution to everything,\" Basil Baig told ABC News.", "", "
Two of the victims were teenagers aged 14 and 16.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Robert Bumsted)
", "Axel Acosta, 21, was a computer science major at Western Washington University. His father, Edgar Acosta, told KOMO-TV his son was among the victims who died at the festival.", "The school in Bellingham, Washington, released a statement Sunday: \"By all accounts, Axel was a young man with a vibrant future. We are sending our condolences to his family on this very sad day.\"", "Reuters/AP"]
